ygData.subject: Re: Price Fixing
ygData.msgSnippet: Santa Barbara. Cool.. I lived in LA for a long time... but now I enjoy the price of Gas in Nashville.  Actually the price is the same.. just the tax is a lot
ygData.messageBody:
Santa Barbara. Cool.. I lived in LA for a long time... but now I enjoy the
price of Gas in Nashville. Actually the price is the same.. just the tax is
a lot lower. anyway...

I dont mind a virtual Trade Union who trys to get prices to a 'more
profitable' level to recoup some R&D cost, but if an independent wants to
try to come in and take the market with Low prices/High Volume... That fine
with me.. He still makes money.. I get cheap goods..

Too bad all servers are not PvP. The price fixers could start their own
virtual MOB! You stay out of our market.. or... we send Bubba the Troll to
visit ya.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Lemac Justerian [mailto:lemac@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 20, 1999 5:58 PM
> To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Price Fixing
>
>
> From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
>
> > From: "Daniel C. Daugherty" <daniel@...>
> >
> > And BTW: the FTC doesn't seem to like price fixing much )
> >
>
> That all depends on who you are... Go to all the stores in your area and
> check the price of milk!
>
> Then do the same with gasoline! Price fixing is everywhere! Where I live
> (Santa Barbara), the CHEAPEST price for gasoline is $1.59 per gallon... Go
> FARTHER away from the refineries to little old Lompoc (an extra 60 miles
> away and 30 miles off the freeways) and the gas is only $1.39!!
> Or, worse
> yet, head to some southern states where the gasoline is only
> $1.25 or so...
>
> Price fixing is done by area and controlled by the markets themselves...
> It's everywhere and on all sorts of products... the FTC is only interested
> when they can get their names in the paper...
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> What do lizards and rock music have in common?
> http://www.onelist.com
> They both have communities at ONElist. Find yours today!
>
>
